title: The 21 Best Lipsticks You Can Buy at the Drugstore
description: The best lipsticks add a lasting punch of pigment to your lips. You don't need to drop by any high-end stores like Sephora or MAC to get your lippie fix - often, you can pick up great, affordable lip products at your local drugstore. This allows you to experiment with all of the latest makeup trends and test new products every season without causing too much of a dent in your wallet. The best drugstore lipsticks leave you with beautiful color without completely drying out your mouth. They range in finishes from creamy to matte and come in liquid formulas, too. It's fun to switch up your lip color daily as you try out different makeup looks, and shopping for new shades at the drugstore allows you to pack your collection with a rainbow of shades without spending a ton of money. Whether you're on the hunt for a vibrant red lipstick or a neutral hue you can wear every day, your local drugstore is bound to have plenty of options. CVS, Walgreens, Target, and Amazon are stocked with cheap lipsticks that are priced no higher than $18. Read on to discover the best drugstore lipsticks that will keep your lips popping all day long, and be sure to check out a few of our favorite PS Beauty Award-winning lipstick formulas while you're at it.
author: Stacey Nguyen
excerpt: Take a look at the best lipsticks you can find at your local drugstore. From liquid to stick formulas, these are our favorite affordable lipsticks.

While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

The best lipsticks add a lasting punch of pigment to your lips. You don't need to drop by any high-end stores like Sephora or MAC to get your lippie fix — often, you can pick up great, affordable lip products at your local drugstore. This allows you to experiment with all of the latest makeup trends and test new products every season without causing too much of a dent in your wallet.

The best drugstore lipsticks leave you with beautiful color without completely drying out your mouth. They range in finishes from creamy to matte and come in liquid formulas, too. It's fun to switch up your lip color daily as you try out different makeup looks, and shopping for new shades at the drugstore allows you to pack your collection with a rainbow of shades without spending a ton of money. Whether you're on the hunt for a vibrant red lipstick or a neutral hue you can wear every day, your local drugstore is bound to have plenty of options. CVS, Walgreens, Target, and Amazon are stocked with cheap lipsticks that are priced no higher than $18.

Read on to discover the best drugstore lipsticks that will keep your lips popping all day long, and be sure to check out a few of our favorite PS Beauty Award-winning lipstick formulas while you're at it.

Best Drugstore Lipstick With a Velvet Finish

L.A. Girl Matte Flat Velvet Lipstick ($4)

The L.A. Girl Matte Flat Velvet line gives your lips a gorgeous velour look. The shea butter in the lipstick makes application a cinch and keeps your lips hydrated.

Most Comfortable Matte Drugstore Lipstick

Wet n Wild MegaLast Liquid Catsuit ($5)

Many beauty gurus call this Wet n Wild lipstick a close dupe to another popular velour formula on the market because of its buttery formula, good staying power, and high pigmentation.

Most Affordable Drugstore Lipstick

Wet N Wild MegaLast Lip Colors ($5)

If you love the colors and long wear time of MAC lipsticks but can't convince yourself to shell out $27, check out these affordable ones from Wet N Wild. In addition to their range of popular colors, these lipsticks include natural enzymes in their formula that hydrate your lips.

Best Shiny Drugstore Lipstick

Rimmel Lasting Finish Lipstick ($5, originally $6)

This long-lasting Rimmel lipstick is infused with black diamond, which brings a reflective shine to your lips.

Best Drugstore Lipstick With a High-End Feel

L'Oreal Paris Rouge Signature Lipstick ($6, originally $12)

This L'Oreal Rouge lipstick is as long-lasting as lipstick formulas get. The pointed brush makes it easy to outline your lips and get a sharp line of color.

Best Soft-Matte Drugstore Lipstick

NYX Soft Matte Lip Cream ($7)

Coming in everything from vampy colors like Transylvania to cheerful pink hues like Antwerp, the classic lipsticks have a formula that dries matte on the lips but feels incredibly comfortable. The doe-foot applicator allows you to apply the product evenly so that your lips always look on point.

Best Hydrating Drugstore Lipstick

L'Oréal Color Riche Lipsticks ($7)

Made with vitamin E and omega-3, the L'Oréal Color Riche lipsticks produce a beautiful shine on your lips and make sure they stay soft and supple.

Most Pigmented Drugstore Lipstick

Milani Color Statement Lipstick ($7)

One layer of this formula is all you need — the color is highly pigmented. The lipstick also has vitamins A and C in it to keep your lips kissable-y soft.

Best Natural Drugstore Lipstick

Burt's Bees 100% Natural Moisturizing Lipstick ($8, originally $9)

Made with natural ingredients like beeswax and raspberry seed oils, this gorgeous formula comes in a range of natural shades. As an added bonus, it's sulfate- and paraben-free!

Best Moisturizing Drugstore Lipstick

Almay Lip Vibes Lipstick ($8, originally $9)

With vitamins E and C and shea butter in the ingredients, this Almay formula feels silky smooth and comfortable on your lips.

Most Luxurious-Feeling Drugstore Lipstick

E.l.f. O Face Satin Lipstick ($9)

These E.l.f. lip colors could easily be mistaken for high-end when you take into account the sleek packaging and nourishing formula. Add in the wide range of colors you can purchase and you'll be wanting to add quite a few of these lipsticks to your makeup collection.

Best Long-Wearing Drugstore Lipstick

Maybelline SuperStay Matte Ink Lip Color ($10)

Available in unique shades that range from orange to gray, this line of lipstick's applicator comes with an arrow-shaped tip that allows you to precisely paint your lips. Additionally, the super-pigmented formula lasts up to 16 hours.

Drugstore Lipstick With the Best Color Payoff

Revlon Super Lustrous Lipstick ($10)

This Revlon option contains Vitamin E and avocado oil for conditioning your lips. It also contains Abyssinian oil, which gives it a shiny, vibrant color payoff.

Best Transfer-Resistant Drugstore Lipstick

CoverGirl Outlast Lipstick ($11)

You put a topcoat over your manicure anytime you want to make it last, so why not apply the same logic to your lipstick? This CoverGirl lipstick has a two-step application system and the lip color is available in 41 transfer-resistant shades that each come with a moisturizing topcoat.

Best Professional-Grade Drugstore Lipstick

NYX Professional Makeup Matte Lipsticks ($11, originally $12)

From deep crimsons like Alabama to muted plums like Tea Rose, this NYX lipstick comes in shades for everyone. The silky formula, infused with natural waxes like carnauba and candelilla wax, applies smoothly and keeps your lips hydrated all throughout the day.

Best Matte Drugstore Lipstick

The Lip Bar's Matte Liquid Lipstick ($13)

A long day is no match for this Lip Bar lipstick. It's made with a long-lasting, vegan formula that won't budge even after the toughest of days.

Best Demi-Matte Drugstore Lipstick

Winky Lux Lip Velour Demi Matte Lipstick ($16)

Winky Lux's Lip Velour is a creamy matte lip color that only requires a single swipe to cover your lips in bold color. What's more, it is flavored like vanilla.

Best Drugstore Lipstick For Deep Skin Tones

Mented Cosmetics Semi-Matte Lipstick ($17)

The finish on this Mented lipstick can best be described as a comfortable matte. It's not shiny, but it's not dry like most matte lipstick formulas either. You can get it in nine universally flattering shades.

— Additional reporting by Ariel Baker and Balim Tezel

Stacey Nguyen is a writer who has worked with PS, Buzzfeed, HappySprout, The Spruce, The Bold Italic, and more. After graduating from UC Berkeley in 2016, she started working as a lifestyle and entertainment writer, compiling everything from home décor shopping guides to comprehensive timelines of the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Ariel Baker is a former assistant editor for PS Beauty. Her areas of expertise include celebrity news, beauty trends, and product reviews. She has additional bylines with Essence and Forbes Vetted.

Balim Tezel (she/her) is a shopping updates editor at PS and the founder of Maison des Nus, a New York-based affordable luxury brand. She graduated from Northwestern University's Medill School of Journalism.
